intro: Ilex decidua var. decidua, commonly known as the Arizona white oak, is a deciduous evergreen shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States. It features oval, leathery leaves that are typically gray-green in color and have a distinctive silvery underside. The plant produces small, bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in desert regions.
